title: Add support for excluding certain active connections from multi ssh commands
author: kk2526
body_snippet:
*Original Description:*
Requesting feature to disable/enable accepting commands for "Multi ssh"

------
*Merging request from #1100:*

Send command using the MultiSSH toolbar only to the SSH connection inside the currently focused Connection Panel. Preferably optional by checkbox. 

## Expected Behavior
It would be nice if there would be an option to limit the command forwarding only to the SSH connections, which are in the currently focused Connection Panel.

## Current Behavior
Cur...

comments.snippet: Can you provide more context around this request? Do you want to disable multi ssh for all connections or just certain ones?
comments.author: sparerd

comments.snippet: Just on some certain windows. I am not sure if this is still in place. Thanks!
comments.author: kk2526

comments.snippet: That makes sense. You might be connected to 6 servers but only want to send commands to 4 of them. Currently, you would need to log off of the two servers which you didn't want to send commands to. Ideally, you would just briefly exclude those 2 from receiving the multi-ssh commands. We can look into adding this.
comments.author: sparerd

comments.snippet:
Thanks! 
Also if you can add Panel wise enable/disable so we dont have to do on each connection window.
Like I have three panels, each has 6 connections and I want multi ssh commands only on Panel-2. I can disable 1 and 3.
comments.author: kk2526

comments.snippet: Yea that makes sense. We can design the solution to allow that use-case
